There are Sriracha bottles scattered about for your spicy-dosing pleasure. They also have an outside covered patio with several tables. I love the patio during non-summer months. We come during the lunch rush and the service is always pretty fast. When we're rushing or just being lazy, their convenient drive-thru saves the day.  The parking lot can get very busy though, and sometimes there's a tight squeeze between the parked cars & the drive-thru, so be cautious with your vehicle. 

Z's Greek is an awesome lunch or dinner spot for veg*ns & omnivores. Consistently amazing food. Best falafel in the Valley, hands down.

Love Greek food and this place has some of my favorites.  Don't let the fast food look fool you. I do love the fact they have a drive thru which is a savior after leg day at the gym. The Gyro are a must and love their Greek salad. Like mention before they have nice portions.

We've passed by this place for years and decided to try it tonight having moved back to the area.  We were pleasantly surprised! The services was fast and the food was great.  We will be coming back again soon!

Massive portions of the Greek version of comfort food. It doesn't get much better than Z's for the price and convenience. Great staff, quick service, diner feel. I have had probably 80% of the menu and can't say any of them has been subpar. 

I'm here 2x a week for lunch, and my go-to meal is a falafel appetizer and a Greek salad with chicken.

An excellent place for just having an awesomely delicious plate of Greek food! U order from the counter and a very reasonable price then EAT! For $10 I had a great plate of greek salad,  lemon roasted potatoes,  some pita, saffron rice and a generous portion of Gyro meat! If you are near the airport and the traffic is too much, then come to Z's to kill time with some great food and a continuous stream of Greek music with some TVs! OPA!

I've had Z's bookmarked pretty much forever, but never actually went there... SO when headed to another restaurant down the street and found they were closed, I decided to give Z's a shot. The husband had a gyro and I had a chicken pita and we shared some hummus. I asked what the difference was between their two chicken pitas and they told me nothing.... that's weird.... why list two pitas that are actually exactly the same? Anyway, the hummus was ok, but nothing special. It was a little on the bland side, but the pita bread was fluffy and tasty. The sandwich was also ok....The veggies were fresh, but I wish it had more garlic or something else to add to the flavor. To be honest, the best thing we had was the salad dressing.... so flipping good! Anyway, I probably wouldn't make a special trip here.

Been craving greek food lately, every chance I get I'm looking for a gyro sandwich. I have to say this place has the best gyro sandwich I've had in the valley. Lots of vegetables and just the right amount of meat that's not too greasy. They even have drive-thru. I haven't tried any of their other items yet but I'll come back anytime I'm in the area.

Delicious food, large portions. Its family owned and tastes like a happy Greek grandma made my food! The marinated chicken platter is my favorite- great spices and flavor. Clean bathrooms too! Love this place. Opa!

Love it!!! For years I have been going to Z's at least once a week (sometimes more ) to get their awesome village salad with gyro  and grilled chicken. It is the perfect healthy dinner. Definitely make sure to order an extra side oftheir delicious Tzatsiki sauce. You will love it! The staff rocks too.

Like so many other places, I tried Z-Greeks because of one of my customers. While at work one evening I met Karen and her husband. Karen works there. Not many days following my service to them, I decided to gallivant to this locale. Like The Stand it has that "Mom & Pop" look about it. I love that. Simple. I was greeted by Karen, and having  eaten little Greek cuisine, Karen helped me out in deciding on an appropriate fair. I am not a fan of Lamb at all so she suggested the Chicken Pita. Good choice.

I selected their small Greek salad as my side. The veggies were crisp and fresh, and the dressing was rich and creamy. Very delicious. The size of this Pita was immense. I'm a big guy and could really put away some groceries, but this was big. The chicken was cooked perfectly and seasoned very well. The dressing and vegetables were a delicious part of this gargantuan mass of Greco-tastiness. The pita was soft, easy to chew and had a slight buttery taste. 

The ambiance was very casual with traditional Greek music playing, fitting to the bill of fair. I recommend Z's to anyone looking to try Greek cuisine for the first time or to the seasoned Greco coinsure wanting a high quality meal for a great price. Under $9.00 was impressive for the portions. I will return, and so should you.

This is one of the very best spots for gyro wrap and Greek gyro salad.  The vegetables have always been very fresh and crisp, whether it was for the salad, wrap or anything else.  Their falafels are probably the best in town, so if you like that, this is the place to get it.  Prices are very reasonable, the place is not fancy, the staff is very friendly and down to earth.  

The only drawback is that these days it is hard to find a place to sit during my lunch hour.  The secret is out.

The only reason that I don't eat here daily is because I grew up on Greek food, but when I don't feel like cooking, Z's Greek can give me food almost as good as mine.  Okay, since I didn't have to shop for it, cook it, and clean up after, let's be honest, Z's Greek is better.
It's not fancy, but the gyro meat isn't greasy or over salted, the tzatziki tastes darned good, the salads are generous and the fries are always hot and fresh.  One thing they can ALWAYS make better than I can is the pilaf.  Dang them!!! 
On a further lazy note,  if you have a craving while in your PJ's, they even have a drive through.

Such a gem!  Doesn't look like much from the outside but DONT let it fool you!  Who cares what the place looks like when the food is THAT GOOD!  First Greek place I actually LOVED since moving to the area...and they have a drive-thru!

This place has good food and the service is always on point. It's kind of a little hole in the wall that has been 20 different restaurants in the past 20 years until a good restaurant has stuck. We go here with my family tons and we are never disappointed. Try it if you haven't already.
We just had lunch and food was very delicious can't wait to come back and have more of their their dishes it was so friendly ambience and great service from the attendant
Always a solid choice for a Netflix night. Whether you wanna be good with a salad or bad with fries, Z's never disappoints.

I love the gyro platter! For $11 you get a ton of gyro meat, rice, lemon roasted potatoes, side Greek salad, and pita bread. No way could you eat this all in one meal. I also like that they have a drive thru (but be warned it's really slow.... Took me 20 min to make my way through and there were only 2 cars in front of me)

Food was amazing. My Greek Salad with Gyro was huge and sooo good. My oldest daughter had a hot dog combo and the dog was big & juicy. My best friend had a Gyro combo that she said was fabulous. None of us left hungry!

We also had my youngest who was not feeling well. I was thinking she had a hunger headache I'd hoped she would eat once she smelled the food, but that wasn't the case. She declined to order, then sat down & laid her head on the table. One of the guys working (looked to be an owner maybe?) was wiping down the table & asked if my daughter was stick our just tired. We told him she was feeling sick. He then offered her since soup. At first she declined but then after I told her it'd help her throat she decided to get some. When we went to pay for it the gentleman wouldn't allow us to! ...That really touched my soul & for that, besides for the already amazing food, we will be customers at Z's for life. Thank you!

Great first impression!! I called to place a to-go order and although they literally were closing in ten min, the gentleman on the phone was super cool & acted as though it was hours earlier. There was absolutely no hint in his voice of annoyance at the last minute order, as so many restaurant workers would have displayed. I cannot express how accommodating he was on the phone, it was such a relief after having just gotten home from the airport. Exceptional food, had the chicken pita, tzatsiki, and their signature crazy fries (with feta!). Can't wait to return.

I LOVE this place! The food is AMAZing. The food is always ready within minutes of ordering, it is always FRESH, HOT and delicious. The staff is always friendly and smiling.

 I typically get the Chicken Souvlaki and Fries. I have tried the Greek salad and the cakes in the case -- all are great!

Seriously, the best food.

AND they have a drive thru!!

So it is new restaurant Wednesday for us and this is about as good as it gets!  More food then two can eat and the lightest falafel I have ever had!  The rice is light and yummy and well....you have to try it!  Just as someone else said, this place is a diamond in the rough.  Excellent value.

One great perk about Z-Greek, it is on the way home from the gym and it has a drive through option.  I have had higher quality and better tasting Greek food before, so its hard to justify giving anything higher than 3 stars.  I don't eat beef so I have never had the Gyro, but the chicken is decent.  The one thing I am disappointed is that the skimp  out of the meat.  I feel like I am not getting true value for my buck when I order the chicken platter.  The sauces they provide are good but need a little bit more garlic and zest.  Overall considering the time of the day I get food here (late at night near closing), I would still return because of the drive thru option that is convenient when it is blistering hot or raining like crazy during a monsoon.

Really really good. Was so surprised. Have been to a few greek place in AZ (including the ubiquitous pita jungle) and it's all been disappointing. Very fast and friendly service here and they got my order completely right. Will definitely come here a lot.
Great service! Prompt and friendly. Best food I've had in a long time in Phoenix. They give you so much food for what you pay. Amazing. Will be driving from downtown just to go here again.
This was some of the BEST GREEK FOOD I HAVE HAD.. NEW SPOT!! Husband and I loved it. Thank you! Food portions were more the. Expected and the Greek sealed to die for.
Love that they have a drive thru! Ordered a gyros pretty tasty and will definitely be back to try some of their specialty items on the menu!

The chicken pita combo with a side salad is great. They do not skimp on any ingredients. Nothing is fried (NB: this review is specific to chicken pita and salad), and the portions are large enough to have a second meal from the leftovers. Forget unhealthy fast food chains, support a great local business!

This place is bomb. Go there or be square. I love this place, their food is so delish! Greek salads are large and filling and the chicken souvlaki with potatoes and rice is magnificent. Staff is so friendly! And there is a drive thru!!! Helloooooo convenience!!!

My brother took me here the other day for lunch for my first time.  It was great!  Their gyro combo which includes a drink and fries is so reasonably priced at $7.95 +tax.  Free refills on the drink and the fries are seasoned well and extra crunchy.  I love it.  The meat in the gyro is thick and plentiful.  I asked for extra tzatziki sauce - which I don't think they charged extra for.  This is certainly a hole in the wall with excellent food inside.  I'll definitely frequent this place more often for lunch.

Wow! This place made me fall in love with Greek food. Never having Greek cuisine before eating at Z's, I really can't complain. The service is great, the food is cheap, and the quality is outstanding. I have never eaten something so delicious and healthy! I go back at least once a week (or so it seems) to enjoy over and over again. Highly recommended!

I'm always on the lookout for an inexpensive lunch spot near the Arcadia ice rink. Stopped in with a friend and we enjoyed the falafel pita with fries and drink for $8.95. We discovered that falafel is a breaded vegetarian patty. The pita was fresh and soft. The food was delicious and the counter service was helpful. The white and blue decor reminded me of Greece. We enjoyed the patio seating even though there is lots of traffic passing by on Indian School Rd.

Z's is always a hit for lunch - the gyro style cheese steak has remained the go-to for a long time for me, but there are other healthy options as well.  Fries are always tasty, but if you opt for a salad, its loaded with great ingredients and feta cheese!  the interior could use an update, but the food is the reason to dine here, not the ambiance.
